column4: do any of you have ati x800xt card and it works with your ubuntu ?
because I cant get it to work
both x700 and x800 cards are in trouble on Ubuntu. No to me known work arounds, unless ATI have released a proprietary driver for em.
what can I do ? Can I ask ATI support about this problem ?
Do not know how well ATI response on Linux questions, but you could try that, or ...
well... They should answer or Ill tell them that ill charge them because on the box of my card it doesnt say that it doesnt support linux :)
Try to install (using the web URL as docs) the prop. drivers. Worked great for my 9700 card
i installed ati drivers using easyubuntu
Havent used those scripts so I do not know anything about em.
What happens when you start X?
Well that kind of an answer does not help me anything. What kind of error? "No screen found"?
Wht does that CLI command tell you.
send me some message...dont know why it doesnt work...
Maybe a bug in this client... give me a sec, Ill switch
